Name:
USS Reybold (DE-275)
HMS Goodall (K479)
Namesake:
U.S. Navy Lieutenant Commander John Keane Reybold (1903-1942), killed in action as commanding officer of the destroyer USS Dickerson (DD-157) in March 1942
Admiral Samuel Goodall ( ? -1801), British naval officer
Fate:
Transferred to United Kingdom 4 October 1943
Sunk 30 April 1945[3]
Propulsion:
Four General Motors 278A 16-cylinder engines
GE 7,040 bhp (5,250 kW) generators (4,800 kW)
GE electric motors for 6,000 shp (4,500 kW)
Two shafts
Range: 5,000 nautical miles (9,260 km) at 15 knots (28 km/h)
processing systems:
SA & SL type radars
Type 144 series Asdic
MF Direction Finding antenna
HF Direction Finding Type FH 4 antenna
Armament:
3 × 3 in (76 mm) /50 Mk.22 guns
1 × twin Bofors 40 mm mount Mk.I
7–16 × 20 mm Oerlikon guns
Mark 10 Hedgehog antisubmarine mortar
Depth charges
QF 2-pounder naval gun
